Class UserService

@Path("/user") public class UserService extends Object
REST service for user-related operations.

      Registers a new user.
      Parameters:
      registerUserDto - the DTO containing user registration details
      Returns:
      HTTP response indicating the result of the registration process
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the local host name could not be resolved into an address

      HTTP response indicating the result of the email check

    • checkEmail

      @GET @Path("/checkEmail") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response checkEmail(@HeaderParam("email") String email) throws UnknownHostException
      Endpoint to handle email validation. This method receives an email as a header parameter, checks if the email exists in the database, and if it does, returns a CONFLICT (409) status. If the email does not exist in the database, it validates the email format, and if it is valid, returns an OK (200) status, otherwise returns a BAD_REQUEST (400) status.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address to be validated.
      Returns:
      A Response indicating the result of the operation. - OK (200) if the email does not exist in the database and is valid. - BAD_REQUEST (400) if the email does not exist in the database but is not valid. - CONFLICT (409) if the email already exists in the database.
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the local host could not be determined.

    • confirmEmail

      @GET @Path("/confirmEmail/{auxiliarToken}") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response confirmEmail(@PathParam("auxiliarToken") String auxiliarToken) throws UnknownHostException
      Confirms the email of a user.
      Parameters:
      auxiliarToken - the auxiliar token of the user to be confirmed
      Returns:
      HTTP response indicating the result of the email confirmation
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - if the local host name could not be resolved into an address

    • createProfile

      @POST @Path("/createProfile") @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response createProfile(@Context jakarta.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers, UserProfileDto userProfileDto) throws UnknownHostException
      Endpoint to handle profile creation. This method receives a UserProfileDto object and an authorization token as header parameters. It checks if the authorization token exists in the database and if the UserProfileDto object is valid. If both checks pass, it creates a profile for the user associated with the authorization token.
      Parameters:
      headers - The HttpHeaders object from which the authorization token is extracted.
      userProfileDto - The UserProfileDto object containing the user's profile data.
      Returns:
      A Response indicating the result of the operation. - CREATED (201) if the profile was created successfully. - INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR (500) if there was an error creating the profile. - BAD_REQUEST (400) if the UserProfileDto object is not valid. - UNAUTHORIZED (401) if the authorization token does not exist in the database.
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the local host could not be determined.

    • uploadProfilePicture

      @POST @Path("/uploadProfilePicture") @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response uploadProfilePicture(Map<String,String> request, @Context jakarta.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers, @CookieParam("session-id") String sessionId)
      Uploads a profile picture for a user.
      Parameters:
      request - the request containing the image file
      Returns:
      HTTP response indicating the result of the profile picture upload

      Gets the profile image of a user.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - the session ID from the cookie
      Returns:
      HTTP response containing the URL of the profile image

    • forgetPassword

      @POST @Path("/forgetPassword") @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response forgetPassword(@HeaderParam("email") String email) throws UnknownHostException
      Endpoint to handle password reset requests. This method receives an email as a header parameter, checks if the email exists in the database, and if it does, sends a password reset link to the email.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user who wants to reset their password.
      Returns:
      A Response indicating the result of the operation. - OK (200) if the password reset link was sent successfully. - INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR (500) if there was an error sending the password reset link. - NOT_FOUND (404) if the email does not exist in the database.
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the local host could not be determined.

    • resetPasswordCheck

      @GET @Path("/resetPasswordCheck/{auxiliarToken}") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response resetPasswordCheck(@PathParam("auxiliarToken") String auxiliarToken) throws UnknownHostException
      Endpoint to handle password reset checks. This method receives an auxiliar token as a path parameter, checks if the token exists in the database, and if it does, redirects to the password reset page with the token as a parameter. If the token does not exist, it redirects to the home page.
      Parameters:
      auxiliarToken - The auxiliar token of the user who wants to reset their password.
      Returns:
      A Response with a redirection to the appropriate page. - If the token exists, it redirects to the password reset page with the token as a parameter. - If the token does not exist, it redirects to the home page.
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the local host could not be determined.

    • resetPassword

      @POST @Path("/resetPassword") @Consumes("application/json") @Produces("application/json") public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response resetPassword(@Context jakarta.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers, @HeaderParam("newPassword") String newPassword) throws UnknownHostException
      Endpoint to handle password reset. This method receives a new password and an auxiliar token as header parameters. It checks if the auxiliar token exists in the database and if the new password is valid. If both checks pass, it resets the password of the user associated with the auxiliar token.
      Parameters:
      headers - The HttpHeaders object from which the auxiliar token is extracted.
      newPassword - The new password of the user.
      Returns:
      A Response indicating the result of the operation. - OK (200) if the password was reset successfully. - INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR (500) if there was an error resetting the password. - BAD_REQUEST (400) if the new password is not valid. - NOT_FOUND (404) if the auxiliar token does not exist in the database.
      Throws:
      UnknownHostException - If the IP address of the local host could not be determined.
